title.narrative: OUTPUT 33: COMMUNICATION FOR DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Strengthened institutional capacity of Government and NGO partners in Communication for Development (C4D) to plan, implement, and advocate evidence-based social and behaviour change communication, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Reducing Child Poverty, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children in development and humanitarian setting

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened institutional capacity of Government and NGO partners in C4D to plan, implement, and advocate evidence-based socialand behaviour change communication

description.narrative: UNICEF lead the vaccine confidence efforts around COVID-19, yellow fever and polio campaigns through establishing a Misinformation Taskforce, developing the strategies and key messages, and supporting the community engagements.UNICEF continued to work with CSOs partners onbehaviour change interventions.UNICEF supported development of National Strategies for Reproductive, Maternal, Child,;Adolescent Health and Nutrition. UNICEF facilitated innovative channels to reach the most vulnerable groups including mobile response platform, device for group listening, sms, chatbots, digital platforms. ;New experimental research studies were conducted on polio and COVID-19 vaccination hesitancy as well as on social norms around utilization ofhealthcareservices. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2022
